The claim is about the rate at which peo: 2. The claim is based on the Labor Force Participation Rate, which includes the number of people who are either employed or actively looking for work.
The state: s Labor Force Participation Rate as of June 2015 was 67.9 percent, compared to the national rate of 62.6 percent, making it about 5.3 percentage points higher.
Wisconsin: s labor force participation has consistently exceeded the national rate for years, even before Governor Scott Walker took office.
